pyecharts.charts.basic_charts.calendar
======================================

.. py:module:: pyecharts.charts.basic_charts.calendar


Classes
-------

.. autoapisummary::

   pyecharts.charts.basic_charts.calendar.Calendar


Module Contents
---------------

.. py:class:: Calendar(init_opts: pyecharts.types.Init = opts.InitOpts(), render_opts: pyecharts.types.RenderInit = opts.RenderOpts())

   Bases: :py:obj:`pyecharts.charts.chart.Chart`


   <<< Calendar Diagram >>>

   The calendar diagram is mainly used to represent the size of a value by
   color and must be used in conjunction with the visualMap component.
   Two categories of axes must be used in rectangular coordinates.


   .. py:method:: add(series_name: str, yaxis_data: pyecharts.types.Sequence, *, type_: pyecharts.types.Union[str, pyecharts.globals.ChartType] = ChartType.HEATMAP, calendar_index: pyecharts.types.Optional[pyecharts.types.Numeric] = None, label_opts: pyecharts.types.Label = opts.LabelOpts(is_show=False, position='inside'), calendar_opts: pyecharts.types.Union[pyecharts.types.Calendar, pyecharts.types.List[pyecharts.types.Calendar]] = None, tooltip_opts: pyecharts.types.Tooltip = None, itemstyle_opts: pyecharts.types.ItemStyle = None, visualmap_opts: pyecharts.types.VisualMap = None, emphasis_opts: pyecharts.types.Emphasis = None, **other_calendar_opts)
